definitions.body: quiver for arrows (As. isûpatu Dl:K 29) ´[[א]] lit. as part of warlike equipment Job 39:23, Is 22:6; fig. in sim. of sons of one's youth as arrows (weapons which the father may wield) Ps 127:5 [[אַשְׁרֵי הַגֶּבֶר אֲשֶׁר מִלֵּא אֶת־אַשְׁפָּתוֹ מֵהֶם]] the happiness of the man that hath filled his quiver with them ! of Yahweh's quiver, in metaph. of prophet as arrow of ´[[י]] Is 49:2 [[וַיְשִׂימֵנִי לְחַץ בָּרוּר]] [[בְּאַשְׁפָּתוֹ הִסְתִּירָָנִי]] and he made me into a polished arrow, in his quiver he hid me; also of quiver in which ´[[י]] has his arrows of chastisement, [[בְּנֵי]] [[אַשְׁפָּתוֹ]], i.e. his arrows La 3:13 (‖[[חֵץ]] v:La 3:12).
